result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony C Lepak

records.addlTxt:
3:47 PM Defendant Anthony C Lepak not in court.  Attorney Joseph J. Kaupie in court for Anthony C Lepak.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State request for warrant and costs for the witness officer being present here today.
BY THE COURT: Warrant with $500 cash alternative
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.

2:11 PM Defendant Anthony C Lepak appeared by video, in custody at the Waupaca County Jail.  Attorney Joseph J. Kaupie in court for Anthony C Lepak.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Atty Kaupie reserves his right to challenge jurisdiction.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

State is in compliance with victim rights notification.
Record reflects that no victim appears in court today.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Initial Appearance set for August 22, 2022 @ 1:45 p.m. in Br 1
filed by Atty Joseph J. Kaupie
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance set for August 1, 2022 @ 2:30 p.m. in Br 3
Defendant REFUSED to Sign the Signature Bond
No contact or be on the premises of  Walmart in Plover.

1:04 PM Defendant Anthony Charles Lepak appeared by video from jail. Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner is present in court.
ADA Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of Retail Theft. 
Atty Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
State requests a signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner does not have any objections as to bond.
Hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
